title: Ohio Supreme Court Strikes Down New Congressional Map as Favoring GOP
sub_head: Court rules the new map violated a 2018 ballot measure to prevent gerrymandering
body:
The Ohio Supreme Court struck down the stateâ€™s new congressional district map, saying it violated the state Constitution by favoring Republicans.
The court gave the Ohio Redistricting Commission, whose members are appointed by state legislative leaders and also include the governor and two other state officials, 30 days to redraw the map.
